name: code-for-ibmi
description: Maintain your RPGLE, CL, COBOL, C/CPP on IBM i right from Visual Studio Code.

items.description: Object type. Usually starts with an asterisk.

objectFilters.description: List of filters for Object List

libraryList.description: Library list. Used in actions. Highest first.

connectionProfiles.description: A collection of connection settings to easily switch between them on this system.

commandProfiles.description: A collection of commands to easily switch between library list configurations on this system.

ifsShortcuts.description: List of directories shown in IFS Browser

autoSortIFSShortcuts.description: Automatically sort the shortcuts in IFS browser when shortcut is added or removed.

autoClearTempData.description: Automatically delete temporary objects from the temporary library on startup.

currentLibrary.description: Library used as the current library and &CURLIB variable when running actions.

sourceASP.description: If source files live within a specific ASP, please specify it here. Leave blank/null otherwise. You can ignore this column if you have access to `QSYS2.ASP_INFO` as Code for IBM i will fetch ASP information automatically.

sourceFileCCSID.description: The CCSID of source files on your system. You should only change this setting from `*FILE` if you have a source file that is 65535 - otherwise use `*FILE`. Note that this config is used to fetch all members. If you have any source files using 65535, you have bigger problems.

autoConvertIFSccsid.description: Automatically convert IFS to UTF8 when reading and writing.

hideCompileErrors.description: List of codes that will be hidden in the result of an action (from the EVFEVENT file)

enableSourceDates.description: When enabled, Code for IBM i will retain/update source dates of members when editing source members. Requires SQL to be enabled for this feature to work. If this config is changed, you must reconnect to the system.

sourceDateMode.description: Determine which method should be used to track changes to source dates for source member.

sourceDateGutter.description: When enabled along with enableSourceDates, Code for IBM i will display the source date in the gutter of source members.

encodingFor5250.description: The encoding for the 5250 emulator. To use the 5250 emulator, tn5250 must be installed on the remote system via yum.

terminalFor5250.description: The terminal type for the 5250 emulator. To use the 5250 emulator, tn5250 must be installed on the remote system via yum.

setDeviceNameFor5250.description: If enabled, user will be prompted for the terminal device name.

connectringStringFor5250.description: The connectring string for the 5250 emulator. To use the 5250 emulator, tn5250 must be installed on the remote system via yum.

autoSaveBeforeAction.description: Automatically save before running action if editor is dirty

name.description: Variable name. Will be forced uppercase.

showDescInLibList.description: Show description of libraries in User Library List (recommended to also enable SQL).

showHiddenFiles.description: Show hidden files and directories in IFS browser.

debugPort.description: Port to connect to IBM i Debug Service.

debugSepPort.description: Port to connect to IBM i Debug Service for SEP.

debugUpdateProductionFiles.description: Whether the job being debugged can update objects in production (*PROD) libraries

debugEnableDebugTracing.description: Tells the debug service to send more data to the client. Only useful for debugging issues in the service.

code-for-ibmi.postActionView.description: Determine which view should be shown when running Actions

code-for-ibmi.clearErrorsBeforeBuild.description: When true, existing errors will be replaced with errors from the latest build. When false, errors will be appended to the existing list.

code-for-ibmi.grepIgnoreDirs.description: List of directories that will be ignored when searching the IFS.

code-for-ibmi.logCompileOutput.description: If enabled, will log spool files from command executed. You can find it under Output for 'IBM i Compile Log'.

code-for-ibmi.showSeuColors.description: If enabled, will colourise lines like SEU. Only supports source members. Requires restart if changed.

code-for-ibmi.clearOutputEveryTime.description: If enabled, will clear the IBM i Output before an Action is run.

code-for-ibmi.defaultOpenMode.description: The action to take when clicking on a source member or stream file to open it.

code-for-ibmi.autoOpenFile.description: When enabled, files will automatically be opened when copied or moved/renamed.

code-for-ibmi.autoRefresh.description: If enabled, listings will refresh when items are interacted with (create, copy, delele, etc). Turn this off if you find performance is bad.

code-for-ibmi.ObjectBrowser.showNamesInL.description: If enabled, names and types of object and members will be shown in lowercase. If disabled, the names will be shown as is on the server (like in 5250 sessions).

code-for-ibmi.ObjectBrowser.sortObjectsB.description: If enabled, objects will be sorted by object name. If disabled, objects will be sorted by object type (MI object type).

code-for-ibmi.IfsBrowser.DragAndDropDefa.description: The action to take when an item from the IFS Browser is dragged'n'dropped.

code-for-ibmi.clearDiagnosticOnEdit.description: When lines with ILE diagnostics are edited, the diagnostic will be removed. Requires reload/restart if changed.

code-for-ibmi.createLibraryOnBranchChang.description: Used in conjuction with git. When the branch changes, prompt the user if they would like a new branch library for this branch. The branch name, which is deterministic, always starts with 'VS', followed by 8 characters.

code-for-ibmi.recentlyOpenedFilesLimit.description: Number of files to keep in recently opened files list.
enumDescriptions: Do not keep any recently opened files
Keep the 10 most recently opened files
Keep the 20 most recently opened files
Keep the 30 most recently opened files

code-for-ibmi.safeDeleteMode.description: If enabled, when the user tries to delete a directory, they will be asked to confirm the deletion by typing in the directory's name.

code-for-ibmi.showDateSearchButton.description: If enabled, will show the 'Date search' button in the status bar when source dates with diff mode is enabled.

code-for-ibmi.terminals.5250.openInEdito.description: If enabled, 5250 terminals will open in the editor area as tabs instead of panels.

code-for-ibmi.terminals.pase.openInEdito.description: If enabled, PASE terminals will open in the editor area as tabs instead of panels.

code-for-ibmi.autoReconnect.description: The action to take when a source member/streamfile is left opened when VS Code is closed and re-opened.

code-for-ibmi.connections.description: A list of connection details to save you typing again.

code-for-ibmi.actions.description: A list of actions that can be used throughout the extension. For example, you would setup actions to compile source code.

type.description: Support type this action can use

environment.description: Environment for command to be executed in. Default is `ile`.

extensions.description: Extensions that can use this action

postDownload.description: Remote files to download after the Action is complete. For local files only.

deployFirst.description: If enabled and type is local, the deployment process will run before the Action.

refresh.description: What container level should be refreshed after the action is done.

runOnProtected.description: If enabled, this Action will be allowed to run on protected/read only targets.

default.name: Create Bound RPG Program (CRTBNDRPG)
default.command: CRTBNDRPG PGM(&OPENLIB/&OPENMBR) SRCFILE(&OPENLIB/&OPENSPF) OPTION(*EVENTF) DBGVIEW(*SOURCE) TGTRLS(*CURRENT)

default.name: Create Service Program (CRTSRVPGM)
default.command: ?CRTSRVPGM SRVPGM(&OPENLIB/&OPENMBR) EXPORT(*ALL) BNDSRVPGM(*NONE) BNDDIR(*NONE) ACTGRP(*CALLER) TGTRLS(*CURRENT)

default.name: Create SQL ILE RPG Program (CRTSQLRPGI)
default.command: ?CRTSQLRPGI OBJ(&OPENLIB/&OPENMBR) SRCFILE(&OPENLIB/&OPENSPF) CLOSQLCSR(*ENDMOD) OPTION(*EVENTF) DBGVIEW(*SOURCE) TGTRLS(*CURRENT) RPGPPOPT(*LVL2)

default.name: Create SQL ILE RPG Module (CRTSQLRPGI)
default.command: ?CRTSQLRPGI OBJ(&OPENLIB/&OPENMBR) SRCFILE(&OPENLIB/&OPENSPF) OBJTYPE(*MODULE) CLOSQLCSR(*ENDMOD) OPTION(*EVENTF) DBGVIEW(*SOURCE) TGTRLS(*CURRENT) RPGPPOPT(*LVL2)

default.name: Create Command (CRTCMD)
default.command: ?CRTCMD CMD(&OPENLIB/&OPENMBR) PGM(&OPENLIB/&OPENMBR) SRCFILE(&OPENLIB/&OPENSPF) ALLOW(*ALL) CURLIB(*NOCHG) PRDLIB(*NOCHG)

default.name: Create Command (Allow Return Variables - CRTCMD)
default.command: ?CRTCMD CMD(&OPENLIB/&OPENMBR) PGM(&OPENLIB/&OPENMBR) SRCFILE(&OPENLIB/&OPENSPF) ALLOW(ALLOW(*BPGM *IPGM *BMOD *IMOD) ) CURLIB(*NOCHG) PRDLIB(*NOCHG)

default.name: Create Display File (CRTDSPF)
default.command: ?CRTDSPF FILE(&OPENLIB/&OPENMBR) SRCFILE(&OPENLIB/&OPENSPF) SRCMBR(&OPENMBR) OPTION(*EVENTF) RSTDSP(*NO) REPLACE(*YES)

default.name: Create Physical File (CRTPF)
default.command: ?CRTPF FILE(&OPENLIB/&OPENMBR) SRCFILE(&OPENLIB/&OPENSPF) SRCMBR(&OPENMBR) OPTION(*EVENTF) SIZE(*NOMAX) MAXMBRS(1)

default.name: Create Program (CRTPGM)
default.command: ?CRTPGM PGM(&OPENLIB/&OPENMBR) MODULE(*PGM) ENTMOD(*FIRST) BNDSRVPGM(*NONE) BNDDIR(*NONE) ACTGRP(*ENTMOD) TGTRLS(*CURRENT)

default.name: Create Bound RPG Program (CRTBNDRPG) with inputs
default.command: CRTBNDRPG PGM(${buildlib|Build library|&BUILDLIB}/${objectname|Object Name|&NAME}) SRCSTMF('${sourcePath|Source path|&FULLPATH}') OPTION(*EVENTF) DBGVIEW(*SOURCE) TGTRLS(*CURRENT) TGTCCSID(*JOB)

default.name: Create Bound RPG Program (CRTBNDRPG)
default.command: CRTBNDRPG PGM(&BUILDLIB/&NAME) SRCSTMF('&FULLPATH') OPTION(*EVENTF) DBGVIEW(*SOURCE) TGTRLS(*CURRENT) TGTCCSID(*JOB)

default.name: Create Service Program (CRTSRVPGM)
default.command: ?CRTSRVPGM SRVPGM(&BUILDLIB/&NAME) EXPORT(*ALL) BNDSRVPGM(*NONE) BNDDIR(*NONE) ACTGRP(*CALLER) TGTRLS(*CURRENT)

default.name: Create SQL ILE RPG Program (CRTSQLRPGI)
default.command: ?CRTSQLRPGI OBJ(&BUILDLIB/&NAME) SRCSTMF('&FULLPATH') CLOSQLCSR(*ENDMOD) OPTION(*EVENTF) DBGVIEW(*SOURCE) TGTRLS(*CURRENT) CVTCCSID(*JOB) RPGPPOPT(*LVL2)

default.name: Create SQL ILE RPG Module (CRTSQLRPGI)
default.command: ?CRTSQLRPGI OBJ(&BUILDLIB/&NAME) SRCSTMF('&FULLPATH') OBJTYPE(*MODULE) CLOSQLCSR(*ENDMOD) OPTION(*EVENTF) DBGVIEW(*SOURCE) TGTRLS(*CURRENT) CVTCCSID(*JOB) RPGPPOPT(*LVL2)

commands.title: Save Current Settings to New Profile...

viewsWelcome.contents:
No connection found.
[Connect to an IBM i](command:code-for-ibmi.connect)

The User Library List is currently disabled. This happens when another extension wants to manage the library list.
[Force Enable](command:code-for-ibmi.userLibraryList.enable)

scripts.typings: npx -p typescript tsc ./src/extension.ts --declaration --allowJs --emitDeclarationOnly --outDir types --esModuleInterop -t es2022 --moduleResolution node --resolveJsonModule
